intro: Turritis minor, commonly known as the lesser turritis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Turritis minor is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in partial shade.
